\text{Convolution operation can be expressed as:} \\
\quad (I * K)(x, y) = \sum_{m} \sum_{n} I(x - m, y - n) K(m, n) \\
\text{where, } I \text{ is the input image, } K \text{ is the kernel.} \\
\text{PyTorch example code:} \\
\begin{align*}
\text{import torch} \\
\text{import torch.nn as nn} \\
\text{conv = nn.Conv2d(in_channels=1, out_channels=1, kernel_size=3, padding=1)} \\
\text{input = torch.randn(1, 1, 5, 5)} \\
\text{output = conv(input)}
\end{align*}

\text{The core of the backpropagation algorithm is the chain rule, computing the gradient of the loss } L \text{ with respect to the weights } w:} \\
\quad \frac{\partial L}{\partial w} = \frac{\partial L}{\partial y} \cdot \frac{\partial y}{\partial w} \\
\text{where, } y \text{ is the output of the neural network.} \\
\text{In convolutional layers, the gradient of weights is computed as the convolution of input and error:} \\
\quad \Delta w = x * \delta \\
\text{where, } x \text{ is the input, } \delta \text{ is the error term.}

summary: This intelligent assistant specializes in the fields of machine learning and deep learning, with particular expertise in detailed explanations of image processing and computer vision concepts. It can accurately and systematically output complex mathematical formulas, algorithm descriptions, and code examples in LaTeX format, supporting practical demonstrations using frameworks like PyTorch and OpenCV. Whether for theoretical explanations, model building, or code implementation, it provides clear, professional, and concise answers to help users deeply understand core principles and application details of machine vision technology, greatly improving research and engineering efficiency and quality.
